devdoc.author: Tellor Inc.
devdoc.details: Chorus is a structure for issuing semi-stablecoins as community currencies*

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

collateralBalance().details: Returns the current token price in USD reduced by the current inflation.

collateralPrice().details: Checks the Tellor oracle and gets the collateral price

returns._0: uint256 collateral price in USD upscaled to e18 precision.

collateralRatio().details: A view funciton to look at the collateralization of the system

returns._0: uint256 collateral token balance of this address / totalSupply

constructor.details: This is the constructor, sets the inital paramaters in the system The parameters include, the Tellor Address, collateral token's address, collateral token's requestID, the price granualrity, the token name,  token's symbol, inflation rate per year, and the inflation beneficiary

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

depositCollateral(uint256).details: Allows the admin to deposit collateral

params._amount: the amount of collateral token to deposit

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

liquidate().details: Function to allow anyone to liquidate the system if it is undercollateralized

mintToken(uint256,address).details: Allows the admin to mint tokens up to the collateral threshold

params._amount: the amount of collateral tokens to mint
params._to: the address to mint them to;

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

setAdmin(address).details: Allows the user to set a new admin address

params._newAdmin: the address of the new admin address

setCollateralPriceAge(uint256).details: Allows the admin to set the collateral price Age (delay in feed from Tellor)

params._amount: the amount of delay in the price feed (we want to wait for disputes)

setCollateralThreshold(uint256).details: Allows the admin to set the Collateral threshold

setLiquidationPenatly(uint256).details: Allows the admin to set the liquidation penalty

params._amount: the amount of the liquidation penalty

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

tokenPrice().details: Returns the current token price in USD reduced by the current inflation.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

updateInflation().details: Function to reduce token price by the inflation rate, increases the total supply by the inflation rate and sends the new tokens to the inflation beneficiary.

withdrawCollateral(uint256).details: Allows the admin to withdraw collateral above the threshold

params._amount: the amount of collateral token to deposit

withdrawToken(uint256).details: Allows a user to withdraw tokens

params._amount: the amount of tokens to withdraw

devdoc.title: Chorus
